p: Later on, in 2002, Davis and Kuttan noted the enhanced proliferation rate of lymphocyte, thymocyte, and bone marrow after administration of plant powder at a dose rate of 20 mg/dose/animal to splenocyte which was pre-treated with PHA and Con A mitogens ( 81). Withanolides isolated from W. somnifera inhibited the growth of cancerous cells in the central nervous system, lungs, breasts, and colon cell lines. It was investigated that withaferin A significantly reduced the growth of breast and colon cancer cell lines more effectively than famous anticancer drug doxorubicin ( 85). Blocking of NFκβ activation sites may involve the inducible or constitutive mechanisms of suppression which resulted in the elevation of apoptosis, inhibition of invasion, and osteoclastogenesis. Withanolide D isolated from leaves of W. somnifera showed exceptional antileukemic activity. The antileukemic activity of withanolide D was mediated by ceramide accumulation after activation of N-SMase2 which in turn enhanced the apoptotic activity of neoplastic cells ( 90).
